title: Big Five traits and impulse control EBQ

content.question: Using the sources provided, develop and justify an argument about which of the Big Five personality traits would be most predictive of a person’s ability to control their behaviors and emotions, known as impulse control. A. Propose a specific and defensible claim based in psychological science that responds to the question.

frqParts.text: Using the sources provided, develop and justify an argument about which of the Big Five personality traits would be most predictive of a person’s ability to control their behaviors and emotions, known as impulse control. A. Propose a specific and defensible claim based in psychological science that responds to the question.

B. (i) Support your claim using at least one piece of specific and relevant evidence from one of the sources. (ii) Explain how the evidence from part B (i) supports your claim using a psychological perspective, theory, concept, or research finding learned in AP Psychology.

C. (i) Support your claim using an additional piece of specific relevant evidence from a different source than the one that was used in part B (i). (ii) Explain how the evidence from part C (i) supports your claim using a different psychological perspective, theory, concept, or research finding learned in AP Psychology than the one that was used in part B (ii).

topic.text: 4.5: Social-Cognitive and Trait Theories of Personality
